title: Student Equity & Inclusion Planning Survey
subtitle: For Teachers and Program Leaders | Ugly Duck School – Kunming, China

intro.purpose: This survey is conducted by the Spark-OS Team to better understand broader school-wide trends around student equity, access, and inclusion landscape at your learning center. Your professional insights will help us to identify patterns and priorities that can support:
intro.bullet1: Improved program design tailored to diverse student needs
intro.bullet2: Better resource alignment and school-wide planning
intro.bullet3: Stronger, data-informed collaboration between your school and support networks
intro.bullet4: A more inclusive, culturally safe, and supportive learning environment for all learners
intro.confidential: All responses are strictly confidential and will only be used for internal review, planning, and future collaboration strategies.

consent.text: I understand that this survey helps improve overall school planning and I agree to share my professional insights.

campusLevels.label: Campus Level(s) You Work With (Select all that apply)
campusLevels.alternative: Young Adult / Alternative Pathways: Special Programs

tenure.label: How long have you worked at this School?

enrollment.label: Estimated number of students enrolled at your site

identities.label: Cultural or Linguistic Identities You Observe (Select all that apply)

challenges.label: Estimate how many students face the following systemic challenges

gapsDynamics.label: Which gaps or social dynamics affect student engagement? (Select all that apply)
gapsDynamics.shame: Shame or fear of asking for help
gapsDynamics.mistrust: Parent mistrust or disconnection from school
gapsDynamics.fear: Fear of being bullied for being 'different'
gapsDynamics.homeEnvironment: Home environments with little academic support
gapsDynamics.cultural: Cultural mismatch between home and classroom

unmetNeeds.label: Do you believe there are students with unmet hidden needs (e.g., undiagnosed ADHD, trauma)?

curriculum.label: Does your curriculum reflect the lived experiences and identities of your student population?
curriculum.not: Not really – mostly traditional or standardized

accessibility.label: How accessible is the physical and digital school environment? (Select all that apply)
accessibility.wheelchair: Accessible to wheelchair users / mobility needs
accessibility.barriers: Physical and digital barriers still exist

assessments.label: Do current assessments or placement practices accommodate diverse learning styles and backgrounds?

followUp.label: Are there clear and timely follow-up systems for students identified as needing extra support?
followUp.yes: Yes – interventions are responsive and consistent
followUp.sometimes: Sometimes – but depends on staff or timing
followUp.rarely: Rarely – follow-up is inconsistent or delayed
followUp.unsure: Not sure / not involved in this area

leastSupported.label: Which student groups currently receive the least tailored support? (Choose up to 3)
leastSupported.undiagnosed: Students with undiagnosed or unrecognized learning needs
leastSupported.neurodivergent: Students with neurodivergent traits (e.g., ADHD, autism, dyslexia)
leastSupported.trauma: Students experiencing trauma or family instability
leastSupported.irregular: Students with irregular attendance or transitions
leastSupported.physical: Students with physical, communication, or health-related disabilities

schoolSystems.label: What school-wide systems are in place to address accessibility? (Select all that apply)
schoolSystems.referral: Referral process for suspected learning needs
schoolSystems.food: Access to food/snacks or emergency aid
schoolSystems.cultural: Cultural awareness days or inclusion campaigns
schoolSystems.none: None or very limited systems in place

equipped.label: Do you feel equipped and supported to meet student diversity needs?
equipped.no: No – I feel under-resourced or unsupported

workload.label: How would you describe your current workload in supporting diverse learners?

limits.label: What limits your ability to support students more effectively? (Select all that apply)

pdNeeds.label: What kinds of professional development or team training would help you support students more effectively? (Select all that apply)

urgentGaps.label: In your opinion, what are the most urgent inclusion-related gaps at the school level? (You may refer to scheduling, materials, referrals, environment, or culture)

feedbackLoops.label: What feedback loops currently exist for student voices to shape school policy or culture? (Select all that apply)

confidence.label: How confident are you that feedback like this leads to school change?

staffUsage.label: To what extent do staff at your site use AI tools (e.g., Deep Seek, ChatGPT) in their professional practice?

educatorTasks.label: Which tasks do educators use AI for? (Select all that apply)

studentPercentage.label: Approximately what percentage of your students use AI tools for homework or learning activities?

benefitsRisks.label: What benefits or risks do you foresee in expanding AI support across the school?

strengths.label: What are the current strengths of your center's relationship with families?

barriers.label: What barriers do families face when engaging with the school? (Select all that apply)
barriers.trust: Lack of trust or past school trauma
barriers.priorities: Family priorities may differ from school expectations
barriers.limited: Limited engagement or availability from families

restorative.label: Does your school use restorative or inclusive approaches to address behavior and conflict?
restorative.some: Some staff use restorative tools, but not consistently
restorative.traditional: Primarily traditional discipline methods are used

events.label: Which types of inclusion-focused events or practices are active at your center? (Select all that apply)

partnerships.label: Which external partnerships would strengthen inclusion or wraparound support? (Select all that apply)

overlooked.label: What student groups or support issues do we most overlook as a school?

suggestions.label: Any suggestions for how the school can build a more equitable and welcoming space for all?

exclusion.label: Have you observed patterns of exclusion, bullying, or marginalization related to identity (race, gender, neurodivergence, language, etc.)?

situations.label: If yes, what types of situations tend to arise?

inclusive.label: What would a truly inclusive and culturally safe environment look like in this school?

thankYou.title: Thank you for sharing!
thankYou.message: Your responses will help us create a learning experience that celebrates students' strengths and supports their needs.
